job_history.work_description: I am responsible for the direction of the Finance Division of HSC Shared Services. I currently supervise a team of three supervisors and six accountants.
responsible for managing the business operations of the department, coordinating the flow of information within the office, facility cores and throughout the membership.
I processed payroll records, maintained employee leave records, entered purchase requisitions for equipment and supplies, and reallocated procurement card expenditures.

I assisted the Center Director by arranging meetings, booking travel, submitting travel reimbursements, coordinating his calendar, answering telephone calls, composing routine correspondence and formatting manuscripts and publications in accordance with the editors preferred style.
I was originally hired in the Centralized Order Entry (COE) department entering new orders or changes to the existing business customer's internetand telephone services.
I taught Microsoft Office products, such as Excel, Word, Access, Outlook, and Windows, Wilton Cake Decorating and other AdultEducation Classes.
I was responsible for receiving and tracking all accounts receivable, accounts payable, all financial reports and taxes using Quick Books Computer Software.
I was responsible for all aspects of the daily operations of this business.
I was responsible for secretarial duties including docketing court cases, filing, receiving telephone calls, client correspondence and client relations.

I was responsible for ordering and maintaining all inventory supply levels, tracking employee benefit time, scheduling business appointments, receiving telephone calls, issuing personnel reports, and general secretarial duties.

I was responsible for all billing and tracking of accounts receivable, scheduling business appointments, setting up and maintaining all office computers, all office correspondence, designing and implementing all promotional materials, microfilming and maintaining organization of all office documents, payroll and accounts payable functions.

education.domain: Basic Business Courses, Accounting I & II, French I & II, College Prep English
Organizational Leadership & learning Leadership & Organizational Development

skills.name: Leadership
skills.explanation: Has extensive experience in leadership roles, including supervising teams and managing business operations, indicating expert-level mastery.

skills.name: Accounting
skills.explanation: Has extensive experience in accounting, including managing accounts receivable, accounts payable, and financial reports, indicating expert-level mastery.

skills.name: Payroll Management
skills.explanation: Has experience in payroll management, including processing payroll records and managing employee benefit time, indicating strong proficiency.

skills.name: Financial Management
skills.explanation: Has experience in financial management, including managing budgets and financial reports, indicating strong proficiency.

skills.name: Microsoft Office
skills.explanation: Has experience teaching Microsoft Office products, including Excel, Word, Access, Outlook, and Windows, indicating strong proficiency.

skills.name: QuickBooks
skills.explanation: Has experience using QuickBooks for financial management, including tracking accounts receivable and accounts payable, indicating solid working proficiency.

skills.name: Project Management
skills.explanation: Has experience managing business operations and coordinating projects, indicating solid working proficiency.

skills.name: Communication
skills.explanation: Has experience in secretarial duties, including client correspondence and client relations, indicating solid working proficiency.

skills.name: Time Management
skills.explanation: Has experience managing multiple tasks and responsibilities, including scheduling appointments and tracking employee benefit time, indicating solid working proficiency.

skills.name: Organizational Development
skills.explanation: Has some experience in organizational development, including designing and implementing promotional materials, indicating some practical experience.

skills.name: Higher Education Administration
skills.explanation: Has some experience in higher education administration, including earning a Master's degree in the field, indicating some practical experience.
